toc_entry.title: Every Good Boy Does Fine
toc_entry.description: In the late seventies, celebrated pianist Van Cliburn inexplicably disappeared from public life. No tortured artist in hiding, Cliburn is having the time of his life sitting around his Fort Worth mansion in his bathrobe.

toc_entry.title: The Longest Ride Of His Life
toc_entry.description: When Randall Adams was sentenced to death ten years ago, the Dallas community thought a cop killing had been put to rest. But it hasn’t.

toc_entry.title: A Field Guide
toc_entry.subtitle: Coots
toc_entry.description: A crusty, cranky, curmudgeonly species of bird is proliferating within our borders. And maybe that’s good.

toc_entry.title: Home, Home On the Road
toc_entry.description: If it fits on your dashboard, you can take it with you.

toc_entry.title: Blind Justice
toc_entry.description: Should a judge’s friendships survive his election to the Supreme Court of Texas?

toc_entry.title: Heads, We Win, Tails, You Lose
toc_entry.description: Highly partisan justices are at the center of the Supreme Court scandal.

toc_entry.title: All Aboard For Copper Canyon
toc_entry.description: Try North America’s best travel bargain-the Copper Canyon train ride. For $9 you can see Indians who run down deer on foot, Mennonites who speak German, and the most spectacular scenery in Mexico.

toc_entry.title: The Old Man And the Vines
toc_entry.subtitle: Business
toc_entry.description: My father’s Panhandle grape patch gives him a new cash crop and a new pride as a farmer.

toc_entry.title: Trailer Trash
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Everyone in Raising Arizona has a libido for the ugly, and the guys in Tin Men can’t see past their hood ornaments; Hollywood Shuffle loses its hip mind; Street Smart has a crazed, electric menace.

toc_entry.title: Romancing the Stone
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: Using a circular saw and a shrewd commercial sense, Plano housewife Sandy Stein chiseled a new life for herself as a sculptor.

toc_entry.title: Fruit Of the Vinyl
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: A good record store is more than just a supermarket of sound.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Getting an airline off the ground; achieving your children’s education; cruising through adolescence; rambling through the Valley.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Houston ignores its Aids crisis, Dallas restaurant gossips chew over hard times, San Antonio headline writers get their due. Plus: Chuck Robb’s blooper, Larry McMurtry’s sniffles, and Shearn Moody’s new taste in nightlife.

toc_entry.title: The National Tour Of Texas
toc_entry.description: Travels through the Trans-Pecos —splendor in the Big Bend, the greening of the Alpine grasslands, today’s version of profitable ranching, escape from the rat race in South Brewster County, innkeeping Indians in Van Horn-to El Paso, way out on the edge of Texas.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Hobby may be a Hartbeat from the president; the feds dump nuclear-waste workers on the Panhandle; Cisneros’ future remains rosy; Kathy Whitmire’s doesn’t.
